dt: {bc}to bear or bring forth as a natural product especially as a result of cultivation
{bc}to produce as return from an expenditure or investment {bc}furnish as profit or interest

dt.t: the tax is expected to {wi}yield{/wi} millions

dt: {bc}to give up possession of on claim or demand: such as
{bc}to surrender or relinquish to the physical control of another {bc}hand over possession of
{bc}to give (oneself) up to an inclination, temptation, or habit
{bc}to relinquish one's possession of (something, such as a position of advantage or point of superiority)
{bc}to give up (one's breath, life, or spirit) and so die
{bc}to give or render as fitting, rightfully owed, or required
{bc}to give up (a hit or run) in baseball

dt.t: {wi}yielded{/wi} two runs in the third inning

dt: {bc}to give way to pressure or influence {bc}submit to urging, persuasion, or entreaty
{bc}to give up and cease resistance or contention {bc}{sx|submit||}, {sx|succumb||}

dt.t: facing an enemy who would not {wi}yield{/wi}

dt: {bc}to relinquish the floor of a legislative assembly
{bc}to give way under physical force (such as bending, stretching, or breaking)
{bc}to give place or precedence {bc}acknowledge the superiority of someone else
{bc}to give way to or become succeeded by someone or something else

pt: {sc}yield{/sc} {sc}submit{/sc} {sc}capitulate{/sc} {sc}succumb{/sc} {sc}relent{/sc} {sc}defer{/sc} mean to give way to someone or something that one can no longer resist. {sc}yield{/sc} may apply to any sort or degree of giving way before force, argument, persuasion, or entreaty.
{sc}submit{/sc} suggests full surrendering after resistance or conflict to the will or control of another.

pt.t: a repentant sinner vowing to {it}submit{/it} to the will of God

pt: {sc}capitulate{/sc} stresses the fact of ending all resistance and may imply either a coming to terms (as with an adversary) or hopelessness in the face of an irresistible opposing force.
{sc}succumb{/sc} implies weakness and helplessness to the one that gives way or an overwhelming power to the opposing force.

pt.t: a stage actor {it}succumbing{/it} to the lure of Hollywood

pt: {sc}relent{/sc} implies a yielding through pity or mercy by one who holds the upper hand.

pt.t: finally {it}relented{/it} and let the children stay up late

pt: {sc}defer{/sc} implies a voluntary yielding or submitting out of respect or reverence for or deference and affection toward another.

pt.t: I {it}defer{/it} to your expertise in these matters

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}gieldan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}geltan{/it} to pay
shortdef: to bear or bring forth as a natural product especially as a result of cultivation
to produce or furnish as return
to produce as return from an expenditure or investment : furnish as profit or interest

dt: {bc}the amount or quantity produced or returned

shortdef: something yielded : product; especially : the amount or quantity produced or returned

dt: {bc}production of a biological resource (such as timber or fish) under management procedures which ensure replacement of the part harvested by regrowth or reproduction before another harvest occurs

shortdef: production of a biological resource (such as timber or fish) under management procedures which ensure replacement of the part harvested by regrowth or reproduction before another harvest occurs
